node.html:
Como voc√™s j√° devem estar sabendo, aconteceu um evento de distribui√ß√£o de um Jirachi especial no Brasil, organizado pela Latamel. Foi lindo, eu fui no pen√∫ltimo dia de distribui√ß√£o, na Saraiva Mega Store no New York City Center ‚Äì Rio de Janeiro. Chegando l√°, in√∫meros f√£s de Pok√©mons conversando, batalhando, trocando Pok√©mons ‚Äì O lugar estava repleto de f√£s da Nintendo. Fiquei amigo de um pessoal l√°, jogamos umas partidas de Mario Kart DS enquanto esperavamos o distribuidor do Jirachi voltar do hor√°rio de almo√ßo. Assim que ele retornou, eu fui logo ligando o meu DSi para pegar o Jirachi! Foi muito foda!!!

Eu tive a oportunidade de conversar com o distribuidor do Jirachi, Diego. Ele me explicou que o ponto de partida para esse evento acontecer foi o contato da Nintendo com a Latamel. Isso mesmo!! A Nintendo est√° de olho no Brasil, interessada em fazer eventos, e como esse foi um sucesso, mais est√£o por vir! VAMOS TORCER! Para ler mais sobre o evento, clique aqui.

Para finalizar, consegui fazer um mini-entrevista com Gabriel Teixeira, treinador Pok√©mon que j√° chegou a vencer a Elite Four brasileira. Veja o v√≠deo abaixo.

No final do evento, j√° n√£o via a hora de voltar pra casa e poder realizar tudo que tinha acontecido aquele dia. Mal posso esperar por outro evento da Nintendo. Agradecimentos para o Jo√£o Felipe, por ter me emprestado seu celular para eu tirar uma foto do Diego e por ter me explicado como voltar pra casa üòÉ

Veja abaixo um v√≠deo do Jirachi sendo recebido, e algumas imagens do evento.

node.excerpt: As you may already know, a special Jirachi distribution‚Ä¶
node.html:
As you may already know, a special Jirachi distribution event took place in Brazil, organized by Latamel. It was beautiful, I went to the penultimate day of distribution, at Saraiva Mega Store in New York City Center - Rio de Janeiro. Once there, countless Pok√©mon fans talking, battling, exchanging Pok√©mon - The place was filled with Nintendo fans. I became friends with people there, we played a few games of Mario Kart DS while we waited for the Jirachi distributor to come back from lunch. As soon as he returned, I started turning on my DSi to get Jirachi! It was really cool !!!

I had the opportunity to speak with the Jirachi distributor, Diego. He explained that the starting point for this event to happen was Nintendo‚Äôs contact with Latamel. That‚Äôs right !! Nintendo has an eye on Brazil, interested in doing events, and as this was a success, more are yet to come! LET‚ÄôS GO! To read more about the event, ** click here **.

Finally, I managed to do a mini-interview with Gabriel Teixeira, Pok√©mon trainer who has already won the Brazilian Elite Four. Watch the video below.

At the end of the event, I couldn‚Äôt wait to go home and be able to accomplish everything that had happened that day. I can‚Äôt wait for another Nintendo event. Thanks to Jo√£o Felipe, for lending me his phone, so I can take a picture of Diego and for explaining to me how to get home üòÉ

See below a video of Jirachi being received, and some scenes from the event.

![Jirachi Release](../../uploads/blog/2010/02/jirachi-release.jpg)

As you may already know, a special Jirachi distribution event took place in Brazil, organized by Latamel. It was beautiful, I went to the penultimate day of distribution, at Saraiva Mega Store in New York City Center - Rio de Janeiro. Once there, countless Pok√©mon fans talking, battling, exchanging Pok√©mon - The place was filled with Nintendo fans. I became friends with people there, we played a few games of Mario Kart DS while we waited for the Jirachi distributor to come back from lunch. As soon as he returned, I started turning on my DSi to get Jirachi! It was really cool !!!

I had the opportunity to speak with the Jirachi distributor, Diego. He explained that the starting point for this event to happen was Nintendo's contact with Latamel. That's right !! Nintendo has an eye on Brazil, interested in doing events, and as this was a success, more are yet to come! LET'S GO! To read more about the event, [** click here **](http://www.nintendoblast.com.br/2010/03/pokemon-blast-adquirindo-o-jirachi-da.html "Post on Nintendo Blast").

Finally, I managed to do a mini-interview with Gabriel Teixeira, Pok√©mon trainer who has already won the Brazilian Elite Four. Watch the video below.

`youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iV6LlGLGYlU`

At the end of the event, I couldn't wait to go home and be able to accomplish everything that had happened that day. I can't wait for another Nintendo event. Thanks to Jo√£o Felipe, for lending me his phone, so I can take a picture of Diego and for explaining to me how to get home üòÉ 

See below a video of Jirachi being received, and some scenes from the event.

node.excerpt: Can‚Äôt handle the will to be able to control Link in his new‚Ä¶
node.html:
Can‚Äôt handle the will to be able to control Link in his new Wii adventure anymore? All that perfect MotionPlus movement has left us all biting our lips for this game‚Äôs release, without even thinking about all the mysteries that are already out since the beginning of last year.

But what‚Äôs the fun about spinning the WiiMote to attack an enemy without really feeling the power of the Master Sword? Well, actually you‚Äôll never be able to feel it, but at least, if you‚Äôre fan enough, you can buy the Hero Pack, from Camy International enterprise.

This pack is not new, it was released in the beginning of 2007, when Wii was still a little baby, and a Zelda for Wii was just a dream. I don‚Äôt know why, but it seems this product didn‚Äôt get very famous, and nowadays it‚Äôs practically impossible to find it, but it had everything to work out well ‚Äì With an IGN review and everything.

Watch mini-video-review from IGN about the pack for more information.

After a long search, I finally found this item selling on an italian website, hardstore.com, and for our joy, it ships to Brazil!! =D YAY

The only problem is the price, it‚Äôs not very friendly, the product‚Äôs price is ‚Ç¨13.00 + ‚Ç¨25.00 shipping cost, which gives a total of around R$90,00, that without considering the possible custom taxes when it gets here.

If you‚Äôre interested in, just access its page, clicking here. But take action quickly, on the website it says that the product will expire in July 28, and I don‚Äôt know if they‚Äôll continue selling it after that date.

I obviously already ordered mine, now I just have to wait, and when it gets here I‚Äôll post some photos and videos here (since there is no other video of it on the internet).

See below some more photos of it:
node.rawMarkdownBody:
![Hero Pack](../../uploads/blog/2010/02/hero_pack.jpg)

Can't handle the will to be able to control Link in his new Wii adventure anymore? All that perfect MotionPlus movement has left us all biting our lips for this game's release, without even thinking about all the mysteries that are already out since the beginning of last year.

But what's the fun about spinning the WiiMote to attack an enemy without really feeling the power of the Master Sword? Well, actually you'll never be able to feel it, but at least, if you're fan enough, you can buy the [Hero Pack](http://www.camyinternational.com/heropack/ "Hero Pack"), from [Camy International](http://www.camyinternational.com/ "Camy International") enterprise.

This pack is not new, it was released in the beginning of 2007, when Wii was still a little baby, and a Zelda for Wii was just a dream. I don't know why, but it seems this product didn't get very famous, and nowadays it's practically impossible to find it, but it had everything to work out well ‚Äì With an IGN review and everything.

Watch [mini-video-review from IGN](https://www.ign.com/videos/2007/08/07/camy-pro-hero-pack) about the pack for more information.

After a long search, I finally found this item selling on an italian website, [hardstore.com](http://www.hardstore.com/ "HardStore.com"), and for our joy, it ships to Brazil!! =D YAY

The only problem is the price, it's not very friendly, the product's price is ‚Ç¨13.00 + ‚Ç¨25.00 shipping cost, which gives a total of around R$90,00, that without considering the possible custom taxes when it gets here.

If you're interested in, just access its page, [**clicking here**](http://www.hardstore.com/default.asp?cmd=getProd&cmdID=46422 "Haro Pack @ HardStore"). But take action quickly, on the website it says that the product will expire in July 28, and I don't know if they'll continue selling it after that date.

I obviously already ordered mine, now I just have to wait, and when it gets here I'll post some photos and videos here (since there is no other video of it on the internet).

See below some more photos of it:

![Hero Pack 2](../../uploads/blog/2010/02/hero_pack_2.jpg)

![Hero Pack 3](../../uploads/blog/2010/02/hero_pack_3.jpg)

frontmatter.title: Camy Hero Pack - For those who cannot wait for the next Zelda

node.excerpt: Hoje encontrei uma informa√ß√£o que procurei por muito tempo‚Ä¶
node.html:
Hoje encontrei uma informa√ß√£o que procurei por muito tempo, e hoje encontrei no site do Planalto . Eu li em diversos lugares falando que baixar ROMs √© legal, contanto que voc√™ tenha o jogo original e tudo mais, e at√© mesmo falando que √© legal contanto que voc√™ apague o arquivo ROM em at√© 24h (haha), mas √© foda confiar sem saber a fonte da informa√ß√£o, tanto que eu procurei e encontrei, e n√£o √© bem assim: Voc√™ n√£o pode baixar a ROM mesmo que tenha o jogo original, o que voc√™ pode fazer √© criar uma c√≥pia de seguran√ßa do seu pr√≥prio jogo.

Pois √©! √â dito por lei, o direito do usu√°rio ter uma c√≥pia do software no qual ele possui, em outras palavras: Voc√™ pode, sem estar infringindo nenhum lei no Brasil, rodar jogos em seu R4 desde que possua o jogo original. Segue o paragrafo 1 do artigo 6¬∫ da lei 9.609/98: > I ‚Äì reprodu√ß√£o, em um s√≥ exemplar, de c√≥pia legitimamente adquirida, desde que se destine √† c√≥pia de salvaguarda ou armazenamento eletr√¥nico, hip√≥tese em que o exemplar original servir√° de salvaguarda; Com isso, voc√™ pode utilizar os seus flash cards e backup loaders sem problemas, contanto que possua o jogo original. E eu at√© aconselho utilizar flash card e backup loaders para rodar os seus jogos, al√©m de serem mais pr√°ticos, tamb√©m mant√©m o seu jogo original seguro de danos.

Eu mesmo possuo um Twilight Princess para Wii que n√£o funciona mais, mas como ainda tenho o jogo, caixa, manual e at√© a nota fiscal, continuo jogando o jogo pela c√≥pia que eu fiz quando o adquiri. Isso √© s√≥ pra mostrar como flash cards s√£o legais, tanto que a Nintendo j√° tentou acabar com eles e falhou! Flash cards e backup loaders s√£o totalmente √∫teis para quem gosta de conservar os seus jogos originais, e isso sem contar com o fato da possibilidade de rodar homebrews. Enfim, continuem usando seus flash cards / backup loaders sem medo.

Mas e os emuladores? Bom, nesse caso √© mais complicado, porque n√£o existe nenhum anexo espec√≠fico falando sobre emulador e engenharia reversa na lei 9.609/98, mas mesmo assim √© poss√≠vel determinar a legalidade da utiliza√ß√£o de um emulador por outros fatos. Vamos l√°. Os emuladores s√£o desenvolvidos utilizando a engenharia reversa dos consoles, hackers e engenheiros trabalham para desenvolver um software que interprete os chamados das ROMs para os processadores de computador. O problema √© o seguinte, muitos emuladores utilizam de por√ßoes de c√≥digos do firmware do console utilizado para o desenvolvimento do mesmo, e manter c√≥pia de software de outros em seu computador √© crime.

Ou seja, a √∫nica maneira de um emulador ser legal seria se voc√™ mesmo programasse um em casa. Simples, n√©? Claro que isso n√£o vale para todos os casos, mas √© bom a gente saber que as coisas n√£o s√£o t√£o simples assim e o Brasil possu√≠ sim uma legisla√ß√£o para softwares.

Fonte: planalto.gov.br/

node.excerpt: 2009 foi um ano muito foda! V√°rios lan√ßamentos de jogos‚Ä¶
node.html:
2009 foi um ano muito foda! V√°rios lan√ßamentos de jogos, celulares e filmes fodas. At√© agora eu fico lembrando das minhas ‚Äúconquistas‚Äù desse ano: O monitor, o Wii, o DSi, o PSP, a filmadora etc.

2009 foi um ano bom at√© mesmo para jogos de celular, lembrando o lan√ßamento de Zombie Infection, Sonic, Megaman e ainda noticias da fus√£o da Gameloft com a Capcom.

Esse ano foi anunciado o Spirit Tracks DO NADA e lan√ßado esse ano mesmo, alias, muitos jogos foram lan√ßados, como Brutal Legend, Sillent Hill: Shatted Memories, Little Big Planet (PSP) etc. Anunciaram outros jogos fodas, como Little Big Planet, Assassin‚Äôs Creed e Metal Gear para PSP, Metroid: Other M para Wii e tamb√©m a confirma√ß√£o de que um Zelda para Wii est√° sim sendo desenvolvido!

Esse ano tiveram TANTOS filmes fodas (alguns deles n√£o equivaleram a espectativa, mas foram bons tamb√©m) que eu nem consigo lembrar de todos, mas eu lembro de Gamer, Grace, The Surrogates, The Box.

Namoral, se ano que vem for metade do que esse ano foi, vai ser um ano foda‚Ä¶ mas s√≥ por ser o ano de lan√ßamento de Metroid: Other M, e talvez de Zelda para Wii, j√° est√° sendo MUITO melhor que 2009! Isso tirando os in√∫meros filmes fodas (como Shutter Island) e outras coisas tecnol√≥gicas e jogos que ainda ser√£o anunciados e lan√ßados ano que vem mesmo!

Feliz ano novo pra geral! Divertam-se bastante =D

2010 PORRA!!

frontmatter.title: 2010 chegando

node.excerpt: 2009 was a kick ass year! Several new games, cellphones and‚Ä¶
node.html:
2009 was a kick ass year! Several new games, cellphones and awesome movies. Now I keep thinking of my new things of this year: my new screen, my Wii, my DSi, my PSP, my camcoder etc.

2009 was a really good year, even for the cellphone games, reminding the release of Zombie Infection, Sonic, Megaman and still some news of the fusion between Gamelof and Capcom.

This year was announced the Spirit Tracks OUT OF NOWHERE and released still on the same year. Several games were released, such as Brutal Legend, Sillent Hill: Shatted Memories, Little Big Planet (PSP) etc. Other games were announced, like Little Big Planet, Assassin‚Äôs Creed and Metal Gear for PSP, Metroid: Other M for Wii and also the confirmation that a new Wii Zelda is being developed!

So many good movies came out this year (some of them don‚Äôt came out as expected, but they were good as well) that I can‚Äôt even remember them all, such as Gamer, Grace, The Surrogates, The Box.

Well, if 2010 is half of kick ass as 2009, it‚Äôs going to be an awesome year‚Ä¶ but just being the year that the release of Metroid: Other M, and maybe the new Zelda for Wii, it is WAY TOO BETTER than 2009! Not to remind the several awesome movies (such as Shutter Island) and some other tecnologic things and games that are still going to be announced next year!

Happy new year guys! Have plenty of fun =D

2010!!

node.excerpt: Viram o titulo desse post? √â, vou falar de um assunto‚Ä¶
node.html:
Viram o titulo desse post? √â, vou falar de um assunto extremamente discutido em qualquer forum/blog/fotolog/twitter/bar/museu/escola no mundo: A cronologia dos jogos Zelda. Existe realmente uma? Porque o Shigeru Miyamoto adora fazer esse ‚Äúmindblower‚Äù que deixa todo mundo LOUCO? Se voc√™ perdeu suas esperan√ßas de tentar achar uma seq√ºencia cronol√≥gica para os jogos Zelda, espero que esse post te coloque novamente no caminho da esperan√ßa de que um dia entenderemos o universo de Zelda e sua cronologia.

Para come√ßar, assistam esse v√≠deo (em ingl√™s):

Ao terminar o v√≠deo voc√™ deve ter pensado: ‚ÄúWOW, FODA!‚Äù, assim como eu e muitos outros. Alguns meses depois desse nova teoria ter sido criada, o autor do v√≠deo resolveu mandar o seu v√≠deo para Nintendo, perguntando se ele havia chegado perto da uma solu√ß√£o para a cronologia de Zelda, e a Nintendo respondeu o seguinte: Ou seja: Fodeu? N√£o, n√£o mesmo. O que aconteceu aqui?

Algu√©m muito viciado em Zelda deu uma pesquisada, conseguiu fazer umas conex√µes entre os jogos de Zelda e fez um v√≠deo que ficou famoso no YouTube, quando tentou entrar em contato com a Nintendo, obteve a resposta que n√£o existe nenhuma cronologia concreta em Zelda.

Bom, eu fiquei extremamente chateado com a resposta da Nintendo, e resolvi mandar um e-mail para eles. Escrevi contando a hist√≥ria do contato do ocarinahero10 e de seus v√≠deos, falei que o pr√≥prio Miyamoto disse uma vez que existem duas cronologias em Zelda e at√© citei os Zeldas que tem sequ√™ncias oficiais ( Zelda -> Zelda II ; Ocarina of Time -> Majora‚Äôs Mask ; Wind Waker -> Phantom Hourglass ; Oracle of Seasons -> Oracle of Ages ), e foi essa resposta que eu tive (traduzida):

Ol√° Pablo,

Desde o primeiro Legend of Zelda que foi lan√ßado no NES anos atr√°s, f√£s da s√©rie t√™m tentado encaixar cada jogo numa cronologia, cada jogo representando um epis√≥dio diferente na vida do Link, que varia entre adulto e adolescente.

O lan√ßamento de 2003, The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker finalmente p√¥s fim √† especula√ß√£o e discuss√£o neste assunto, ‚ÄúEsta √© apenas uma das lendas que as pessoas falam‚Ä¶‚Äù O consentimento geral sempre teve o Link como um √∫nico indiv√≠duo.

Contudo, numa entrevista dada na √©poca, pelo editor do jogo, Eiji Aonuma (falando pelo pr√≥prio e por Shigeru Miyamoto, o criador original da s√©rie) constatou ‚ÄúNa nossa opini√£o, no Legend of Zelda, cada jogo tem um diferente Link. Um novo her√≥i chamado de Link cresce para combater o mal.‚Äù > Isto significa que (a n√£o ser que seja especificado) cada jogo representa um novo Link e que n√£o existe uma cronologia referencial poss√≠vel para a s√©rie. Para informa√ß√µes adicionais sobre The Legend of Zelda, por favor visite nosso site oficial Legend of Zelda no seguinte endere√ßo:

www.zelda.com/universe/

Com os melhores cumprimentos,

Sharon Matheny

Nintendo da America Inc.

Home page da Nintendo: http://www.nintendo.com/

Telefone (Informa√ß√£o Autom√°tica de Produtos): (425) 885-7529

Uhmn, espera ai‚Ä¶ j√° vi essa resposta em algum lugar‚Ä¶ pois √©! Eu recebi uma resposta igual √† do ocarinahero10, mas o que isso significa? Significa que o site da Nintendo possui um sistema que identifica as palavras ‚ÄúZelda‚Äù e ‚Äútimeline‚Äù e nem se importa em ler o que voc√™ fala e manda esse e-mail autom√°tico. Chato, eim? Ent√£o eu resolvi dar uma BOA pesquisada na internet sobre indicios do Miyamoto afirmar que existe uma sequencia cronol√≥gica na s√©rie Zelda, e achei est√° cita√ß√£o do Miyamoto:

‚ÄúOcarina of Time √© a primeira hist√≥ria, depois o original Legend of Zelda, depois Zelda II: The Adventure of Link, e finalmente A Link to the Past. N√£o est√° muito claro onde Link‚Äôs Awakening encaixa ‚Äì poderia ser em algum tempo depois de Ocarina of Time.‚Äù

E essa do Eiji Aonuma:

‚ÄúQuanto √† cronologia, Twilight Princess √© cerca de algumas centenas de anos depois de Link ter lutado contra Ganondorf em Ocarina of Time e retornado para a sua pr√≥pria cidade (final de OoT ), e se torna um mundo paralelo at√© The Wind Waker (o eixo do tempo original √© dividido em Ocarina of Time e um mundo paralelo √© criado). Wind Waker come√ßa centenas de anos imediatamente depois do Link adulto ter trancado Ganondorf, Twilight Princess ocorre centenas de anos depois de Link adulto ter sido enviado para seu tempo original pelo poder de Zelda.‚Äù

Duas cita√ß√µes poderosissimas faladas por quem est√° por tr√°s do jogo, que provam que a s√©rie de Zelda TEM SIM uma cronologia =D E agora que voc√™ est√° terminando de ler este post, ficou muito feliz em saber de uma not√≠cia dessas, mas existe um problema: As fontes.

Todas as fontes dessas cita√ß√µes, foram tiradas de blogs e sites sobre Zelda, ent√£o como saber se elas s√£o verdadeiras? Bom, eu fiz a busca da fonte dessas informa√ß√µes, passei cerca de 5 horas procurando de onde veio a primeira cita√ß√£o, e descobri que veio de uma entrevista exclusiva que Miyamoto deu para revista Nintendo Power em novembro de 1998, clique aqui para ler a entrevista.

Essa entrevista s√≥ foi publicada em janeiro de 1999 em uma edi√ß√£o especial da Nintendo Power #116, a edi√ß√£o que apenas quem assina a revista recebe. Eu procurei no Ebay essa edi√ß√£o especial da revista mas n√£o achei =( Ent√£o eu mandei um e-mail para a Nintendo Power e um para Nintendo junto com o link da entrevista, perguntando se √© realmente verdadeira, e eles responderam que sim!

Ent√£o a primeira cita√ß√£o sobre Ocarina of Time ser o primeiro Zelda de todos √© verdadeira e vinda da pr√≥pria boca do Miyamoto =D A fonte da segunda cita√ß√£o, foi bem mais f√°cil de encontrar, eu procurei no site oficial da Nintendo Dream, revista japonesa da Nintendo, e encontrei a entrevista que possui essa cita√ß√£o, para acessar a entrevista (em japones) clique aqui, e para ver a tradu√ß√£o (portugu√™s pelo tradutor da Google) clique aqui.

Voc√™ tamb√©m pode ver a vers√£o traduzida pela Patricia e TSA, do site thehylia.com/ clicando aqui.

Pronto, o trabalho foi feito! Zelda POSSUI uma cronologia, s√≥ precisamos esperar que Shigeru Miyamoto no Wikip√©dia comece a lan√ßar novos jogos de Site oficial que conectem os que j√° sairam.

Zelda √© um jogo de aventura extremamente rico em puzzles, e que, para quem √© mais v√≠ciado, tr√°s uma hist√≥ria de fantasia como nenhuma outra.

Continuaremos jogando Zelda at√© o fim dos tempos o/

Confirta tamb√©m a p√°gina secreta sobre a Timeline de Zelda que eu tenho nesse blog.

node.excerpt: Did you see this post‚Äôs title? Yes, I‚Äôm going to talk about‚Ä¶
node.html:
Did you see this post‚Äôs title? Yes, I‚Äôm going to talk about a really discussed subject that exists on any forum/blog/fotolog/twitter/bar/museum/school on the world: The timeline of Zelda . Is there really one? Why does Shigeru Miyamoto loves to do those mind blower s that lets everybody INSANE? If you lost your hopes trying to find a correct timeline for Zelda, I hope that this post will put you back on track in the way of hope and that one day we‚Äôll understand the universe of Zelda and its timeline.

To start, watch this video:

Now that you‚Äôre finished you must be thinking: ‚ÄúWOW, AWSOME!‚Äù, just like me and others. Some months after this new theory‚Äôs been created, the video‚Äôs author sent it to Nintendo, asking if he got any close to a solution to the timeline of Zelda, and Nintendo answered this:Resuming: are we screwed? No, not at all. What happened here?

Someone really addicted to Zelda searched a little bit, was able to make lots of connections between Zelda games and made this really famous video on YouTube, and when he got in contact with Nintendo, got the response that there was no timeline on Zelda.

Well, I was really upset with Nintendo‚Äôs response, and resolved to e-mail them. I wrote about the contact between ocarinahero10 and its videos, I talked about what Miyamoto himself said once, that there are two timelines on Zelda and even quote the Zeldas that have official sequences ( Zelda -> Zelda II ; Ocarina of Time -> Majora‚Äôs Mask ; Wind Waker -> Phantom Hourglass ; Oracle of Seasons -> Oracle of Ages ), and here‚Äôs the answer of Nintendo.

Hello Pablo,

Since the first Legend of Zelda game was released on the NES years ago, fans of the series have tried to fit each game into a timeline, each game representing a separate episode of Link‚Äôs life. This has lead to much speculation and discussion, particularly over the games where Link switches between adult and young boy.

The 2003 release of The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker finally put an end to the speculation and discussion in its opening line, ‚ÄúThis is but one of the legends of which people speak‚Ä¶‚Äù The basic assumption has always been that Link is a single individual. However, in an interview given at the time it was released, the game‚Äôs director, Eiji Aonuma (speaking for himself and Shigeru Miyamoto, the original creator of the series) stated ‚ÄúIn our opinions, with the Legend of Zelda, every game has a new Link. A new hero named Link always rises to fight evil.‚Äù

This means that‚Äìunless otherwise specified‚Äìeach new game represents a new Link and that there isn‚Äôt a true frame of reference or timeline possible for the series. For additional information on The Legend of Zelda series, please visit our official Legend of Zelda website at the following address:

www.zelda.com/universe/

Sincerely,

Sharon Matheny

Nintendo of America Inc.

Nintendo‚Äôs home page: http://www.nintendo.com/

Power Line (Automated Product Info): (425) 885-7529

Uhmn, wait a minute‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve seen that response somewhere‚Ä¶ right! I got the same response that on ocarinahero10, but what does this means? It means that Nintendo‚Äôs website has a system that identifies the words ‚ÄúZelda‚Äù and ‚Äútimeline‚Äù and doesn‚Äôt even bother to read what you say, and send you that automatic e-mail. Kind of boring, right? So I give it a GOOD look on the internet about Miyamoto saying that there is a chronological sequence on Zelda, and I did find it, here it is Miyamoto‚Äôs statement:

‚ÄúOcarina of Time is the first story, then the original Legend of Zelda, then Zelda II: The Adventure of Link, and finally A Link to the Past. It‚Äôs not very clear where Link‚Äôs Awakening fits in‚Äìit could be anytime after Ocarina of Time.‚Äù

And his one from Eiji Aonuma:

‚ÄúAs for the timeline, Twilight Princess is set several hundred years after Link has fought Ganondorf in Ocarina of Time and returned to his own time (the OoT ending), and becomes a parallel world to The Wind Waker (the time axis originally splits in Ocarina of Time and a parallel timeline is formed). Wind Waker begins several hundred years immediately after adult Link seals away Ganondorf, Twilight Princess occurs several hundred years after the adult Link is sent back to his original time by Zelda‚Äôs power.‚Äù

Two powerful quotes spoken by who‚Äôs behind the game, which proves that Zelda HAS a timeline =D And now that you‚Äôre finishing reading this post, you‚Äôre very happy hearing such news, but there is one problem: sources.

All sources of those information, were took from blogs and websites about Zelda, so how can we tell they‚Äôre true? Well, I searched a little bit about the sources, I spent like 5 hours searching where the first quote was from, and I found out that it came from an exclusive interview with Miyamoto to a magazine called Nintendo Power in November of 1998, click here to read it.

This interview was published on January of 1999 in a special edition of Nintendo Power #116, the edition that only who have a subscription of the magazine gets it. I searched on eBay for that special edition but I didn‚Äôt find it =( So I e-mailed Nintendo Power and Nintendo with the link of the interview, asking if it‚Äôs really true, and they answered yes!

So the first quote about Ocarina of Time being the first Zelda ever it‚Äôs true and was Miyamoto himself who said it =D The source of the second quote was a lot easier to find, I searched on the official website of Nintendo Dream, japanese magazine of Nintendo, and I found the edition that has that quote, to access the interview (in japanese) click here, and to see the translation (english by Google translator ) click here.

You can also check the translated version by Patricia and TSA, from thehylia.com/ by clicking here.

There, job done! Zelda POSSESSES a timeline, we only have to wait for Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia to start launching new games of Official website that are connected to the ones that already exist.

Zelda is an adventure game, really rich in puzzles, which, for who is more addicted to it, brings a fantasy story like no other before.

We‚Äôll keep on playing Zelda to the end of times o/

Also check out the Zelda Timeline secret page I have on this blog.
node.rawMarkdownBody:
![zelda timeline](../../uploads/blog/2009/09/zelda_timeline.jpg "Timeline?")

Did you see this post's title? Yes, I'm going to talk about a really discussed subject that exists on any forum/blog/fotolog/twitter/bar/museum/school on the world: The timeline of [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") . Is there really one? Why does [Shigeru Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") loves to do those mind blower s that lets everybody INSANE? If you lost your hopes trying to find a correct timeline for [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website"), I hope that this post will put you back on track in the way of hope and that one day we'll understand the universe of [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") and its timeline.

To start, watch this video:

`youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F2g65jL3HDg`

Now that you're finished you must be thinking: "WOW, AWSOME!", just like me and others. Some months after this new theory's been created, the video's author sent it to [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website"), asking if he got any close to a solution to the timeline of [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website"), and [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website") answered this:Resuming: are we screwed? No, not at all. What happened here?

Someone really addicted to [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") searched a little bit, was able to make lots of connections between [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") games and made this really famous video on [YouTube](http://youtube.com/ "Official website"), and when he got in contact with [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website"), got the response that there was no timeline on [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website").

Well, I was really upset with [Nintendo's](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website") response, and resolved to e-mail them. I wrote about the contact between [ocarinahero10](http://www.youtube.com/ocarinahero10 "ocarinahero10 on YouTube") and its videos, I talked about what [Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") himself said once, that there are two timelines on [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") and even quote the [Zeldas](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") that have official sequences ( [Zelda](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Legend_of_Zelda_(video_game) "Official website") -> [Zelda II](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zelda_II:_The_Adventure_of_Link "Zelda II on Wikip√©dia") ; [Ocarina of Time](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ocarina_of_Time "Ocarina of Time on Wikip√©dia") -> [Majora's Mask](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Legend_of_Zelda:_Majora's_Mask "Majora's Mask on Wikip√©dia") ; [Wind Waker](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wind_Waker "Wind Waker on Wikip√©dia") -> [Phantom Hourglass](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phantom_Hourglass "Phantom Hourglass on Wikip√©dia") ; [Oracle of Seasons](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oracle_of_Seasons "Oracle of Seasons on Wikip√©dia") -> [Oracle of Ages](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oracle_of_Ages "Oracle of Ages on Wikip√©dia") ), and here's the answer of [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website").

> Hello Pablo,
>
> Since the first Legend of Zelda game was released on the NES years ago, fans of the series have tried to fit each game into a timeline, each game representing a separate episode of Link's life. This has lead to much speculation and discussion, particularly over the games where Link switches between adult and young boy.
>
> The 2003 release of The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker finally put an end to the speculation and discussion in its opening line, "This is but one of the legends of which people speak..." The basic assumption has always been that Link is a single individual. However, in an interview given at the time it was released, the game's director, Eiji Aonuma (speaking for himself and Shigeru Miyamoto, the original creator of the series) stated "In our opinions, with the Legend of Zelda, every game has a new Link. A new hero named Link always rises to fight evil."
>
> This means that‚Äìunless otherwise specified‚Äìeach new game represents a new Link and that there isn't a true frame of reference or timeline possible for the series. For additional information on The Legend of Zelda series, please visit our official Legend of Zelda website at the following address:
>
> www.zelda.com/universe/
>
> Sincerely,
>
> Sharon Matheny
>
> Nintendo of America Inc.
>
> Nintendo's home page: http://www.nintendo.com/
>
> Power Line (Automated Product Info): (425) 885-7529

Uhmn, wait a minute... I've seen that response somewhere... right! I got the same response that on [ocarinahero10](http://www.youtube.com/ocarinahero10 "ocarinahero10 on YouTube"), but what does this means? It means that [Nintendo's](http://nintendo.com/ "official website") website has a system that identifies the words "Zelda" and "timeline" and doesn't even bother to read what you say, and send you that automatic e-mail. Kind of boring, right? So I give it a GOOD look on the internet about [Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") saying that there is a chronological sequence on [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "official website"), and I did find it, here it is [Miyamoto's](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") statement:

> "Ocarina of Time is the first story, then the original Legend of Zelda, then Zelda II: The Adventure of Link, and finally A Link to the Past. It's not very clear where Link's Awakening fits in‚Äìit could be anytime after Ocarina of Time."

And his one from [Eiji Aonuma](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eiji_Aonuma "Eiji Aonuma on Wikip√©dia"):

> "As for the timeline, Twilight Princess is set several hundred years after Link has fought Ganondorf in Ocarina of Time and returned to his own time (the OoT ending), and becomes a parallel world to The Wind Waker (the time axis originally splits in Ocarina of Time and a parallel timeline is formed). Wind Waker begins several hundred years immediately after adult Link seals away Ganondorf, Twilight Princess occurs several hundred years after the adult Link is sent back to his original time by Zelda's power."

Two powerful quotes spoken by who's behind the game, which proves that [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "official website") HAS a timeline =D And now that you're finishing reading this post, you're very happy hearing such news, but there is one problem: sources.

All sources of those information, were took from blogs and websites about [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "official website"), so how can we tell they're true? Well, I searched a little bit about the sources, I spent like 5 hours searching where the first quote was from, and I found out that it came from an exclusive interview with [Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") to a magazine called [Nintendo Power](http://nintendopower.com/ "official website") in November of 1998, [**click here**](http://www.miyamotoshrine.com/theman/interviews/111998.shtml "miyamotoshrine.com") to read it.

This interview was published on January of 1999 in a special edition of [Nintendo Power](http://nintendopower.com/ "Official website") #116, the edition that only who have a subscription of the magazine gets it. I searched on eBay for that special edition but I didn't find it =( So I e-mailed [Nintendo Power](http://nintendopower.com/ "official website") and [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website") with the link of the interview, asking if it's really true, and they answered yes!

So the first quote about Ocarina of Time being the first [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") ever it's true and was [Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") himself who said it =D The source of the second quote was a lot easier to find, I searched on the official website of [Nintendo Dream](http://www.nindori.com/ "Official website"), japanese magazine of [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Official website"), and I found the edition that has that quote, to access the interview (in japanese) [**click here**](http://www.nindori.com/interview/154zelda/154int_02.html "Nintendo Dream"), and to see the translation (english by [Google translator](http://translate.google.com/translate_t?hl=pt-br# "Tradutor da Google") ) [**click here**](http://translate.google.com.br/translate?hl=pt-BR&sl=ja&tl=en&u=http://www.nindori.com/interview/154zelda/154int_02.html "Nintendo Dream").

You can also check the translated version by Patricia and TSA, from [thehylia.com/](http://www.thehylia.com/) by [**clicking here**](http://www.thehylia.com/index.php?subaction=showfull&id=1173582355 "Translation").

There, job done! -#Zelda POSSESSES a timeline#-, we only have to wait for [Mr. Miyamoto](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shigeru_Miyamoto "Shigeru Miyamoto on Wikip√©dia") to start launching new games of [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") that are connected to the ones that already exist.

[Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") is an adventure game, really rich in puzzles, which, for who is more addicted to it, brings a fantasy story like no other before.

We'll keep on playing [Zelda](http://zelda.com/ "Official website") to the end of times o/

Also check out [the Zelda Timeline secret page I have on this blog](/en/zelda-timeline).

frontmatter.title: Zelda timeline?

node.excerpt: When I bought Zeemote I got surprised at first sight: The‚Ä¶
node.html:
When I bought Zeemote I got surprised at first sight: The box is really pretty and comes with the manual, two AAA batteries, Zeemote (duh) and a carabiner to be used as a key chain.

The moment I installed Zeekey and tried Zeemote for the first time, I got really surprised, I admit that I didn‚Äôt expected it to work so good, with such a good response, and Zeekey is a very easy program to use. But to get the inner works, only with time!

I spent almost a month playing several hours with Zeemote a bunch of games that I have on my Nokia E51 and I‚Äôll make a review talking about the pros and cons of Zeemote. Soon as I grabbed my Zeemote, I had a little problem: Batteries. Well, two AAA batteries are a problem, they‚Äôre expensive and don‚Äôt last long, but with time, I‚Äôve realised that they last a lot with Zeemote, but is always better to buy rechargeable batteries.

To synchronize Zeemote with your cellphone is a really simple process, you have to install Zeemote‚Äôs software ( Zeekey ), which has Portuguese language, and in it you‚Äôll have a simple step-by-step explaining how to connect Zeemote on your device. After you connect it, let‚Äôs go to the configs: You can create lots of different profiles, each one of them with its own key mapping personalized to the game you want to play. After the key mapping is done, you just have to select the profile you want to use and let Zeemote running in background: You‚Äôre now free to run any game you want to. When the game started, I got surprised: Zeemote‚Äôs response is unbelievably fast, without any delay, it‚Äôs just great!

I spent 20 minutes playing and I admit that at beginning was a little bit difficult to get used to Zeemote, but as time passed, and after a lot of key re-mapping, I got to the perfect configs. Despite the fast response, bluetooth is not a really fast network, so what happened to me was that Zeemote‚Äôs response friezed for a second and didn‚Äôt answer my commands, but as I was with my cellphone in the other hand, I kept playing with it, and within a second Zeemote was good to go again.

Unfortunately that happened a few times and messes up your game, specially in a crucial part when a lot of commands are sent at the same time, but I believe that this problem can be resolved in the next versions of Zeekey. Another problem that I found was because of the games themselves: Companies don‚Äôt create games thinking in Zeemote (obviously), so some commands, like to move your character diagonally, are not 100% understood by the game itself, which leaves the movement kind of confuse. I don‚Äôt know if you can implement an improvement on Zeekey about this problem, sadly.

Two AAA batteries last quite a long time on Zeemote, in this month that I‚Äôve used it I didn‚Äôt have to change them not even once, and I played quite a long time, I carried Zeemote everywhere. Well, that was kind of a con, I was thinking: To carry Zeemote from here to there all the time. Who wants to walk with a joystick in their pocket? There you think ‚Äúthat‚Äôs a problem‚Äù.

Well, if you consider yourself addicted in video games, buy a Zeemote. Is there a better thing than play Super Mario World in some boring class? üòÖ

Like in every good review, I have to give it a score, so there it goes: 8.0.

node.rawMarkdownBody:
![zeemote](../../uploads/blog/2009/06/zeemote.jpg "Zeemote")

When I bought [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") I got surprised at first sight: The box is really pretty and comes with the manual, two AAA batteries, [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") (duh) and a carabiner to be used as a key chain.

The moment I installed [Zeekey](http://www.zeemote.com/zeekey/ "Zeekey") and tried [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") for the first time, I got really surprised, I admit that I didn't expected it to work so good, with such a good response, and [Zeekey](http://www.zeemote.com/zeekey/ "Zeekey") is a very easy program to use. But to get the inner works, only with time!

I spent almost a month playing several hours with [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") a bunch of games that I have on my [Nokia E51](http://www.nokia.com.br/A4799272 "Nokia E51") and I'll make a review talking about the pros and cons of [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website"). Soon as I grabbed my Zeemote, I had a little problem: Batteries. Well, two AAA batteries are a problem, they're expensive and don't last long, but with time, I've realised that they last a lot with [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website"), but is always better to buy rechargeable batteries.

To synchronize [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") with your cellphone is a really simple process, you have to install [Zeemote's](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") software ( [Zeekey](http://www.zeemote.com/zeekey/ "Zeekey") ), which has Portuguese language, and in it you'll have a simple step-by-step explaining how to connect [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") on your device. After you connect it, let's go to the configs: You can create lots of different profiles, each one of them with its own key mapping personalized to the game you want to play. After the key mapping is done, you just have to select the profile you want to use and let [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") running in background: You're now free to run any game you want to. When the game started, I got surprised: [Zeemote's](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") response is unbelievably fast, without any delay, it's just great!

I spent 20 minutes playing and I admit that at beginning was a little bit difficult to get used to [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website"), but as time passed, and after a lot of key re-mapping, I got to the perfect configs. Despite the fast response, bluetooth is not a really fast network, so what happened to me was that [Zeemote's](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") response friezed for a second and didn't answer my commands, but as I was with my cellphone in the other hand, I kept playing with it, and within a second [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") was good to go again.

Unfortunately that happened a few times and messes up your game, specially in a crucial part when a lot of commands are sent at the same time, but I believe that this problem can be resolved in the next versions of [Zeekey](http://www.zeemote.com/zeekey/ "Zeekey"). Another problem that I found was because of the games themselves: Companies don't create games thinking in [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") (obviously), so some commands, like to move your character diagonally, are not 100% understood by the game itself, which leaves the movement kind of confuse. I don't know if you can implement an improvement on [Zeekey](http://www.zeemote.com/zeekey/ "Zeekey") about this problem, sadly.

Two AAA batteries last quite a long time on [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website"), in this month that I've used it I didn't have to change them not even once, and I played quite a long time, I carried [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") everywhere. Well, that was kind of a con, I was thinking: To carry [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") from here to there all the time. Who wants to walk with a joystick in their pocket? There you think "that's a problem".

I spent the first few days carrying it in my pocket, and then I got used to it and now I can say that it didn't bother me at all, actually [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") is now part of my key chain. It's light and quite small, practically the size of those first Sony MP3 players. My experience with [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website") in the last month was really good and I believe it's only going to get better. Well, if you consider yourself addicted in video games, buy a Zeemote. Is there a better thing than play [Super Mario World](http://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_mario_world "SMW no Wikip√©dia") in some boring class? üòÖ

Like in every good review, I have to give it a score, so there it goes: 8.0.

## Final score: 8.0

The videos below show myself playing some games with [Zeemote](http://zeemote.com/ "Official website"), you can see that its response is great.

**Crash Bandicoot Nitro Kart 3D**:

Quando recebi o Zeemote j√° fiquei surpreso logo de cara: A caixa √© toda bonitinha e acompanha manual, duas pilhas AAA, o Zeemote (claro) e um mosquet√£o para usar como chaveiro. Assim que instalei o Zeekey e usei o Zeemote pela primeira vez, fiquei muito surpreso, admito que n√£o esperava que ele funcionasse t√£o bem, a resposta foi muito boa e o Zeekey √© um aplicativo simples de mexer. Mas pra obter detalhamento do seu desempenho, s√≥ com o tempo mesmo!

Passei quase um m√™s jogando direto com o Zeemote os in√∫meros jogos que eu possuo no meu Nokia E51 e farei aqui um review falando os pr√≥s e contras do Zeemote. Assim que eu coloquei as m√£os no Zeemote, tive um problema: Pilhas. Realmente, duas pilhas AAA √© um problema, elas s√£o caras e acabam muito r√°pido, mas com tempo de uso vi que elas duram bastante com o Zeemote, mas √© sempre recomend√°vel adquirir pilhas recarreg√°veis.

Sincronizar o Zeemote com o celular √© um processo muito simples, eu instalei o software do Zeemote (o Zeekey ), no qual possui o idioma em portugu√™s, e nele possui um passo-a-passo simples mas explicando como conectar o Zeemote ao seu aparelho. Depois de conectado, vamos as configura√ß√µes: Voc√™ pode criar in√∫meros perfis de mapeamento, cada um com as teclas personalizadas para o jogo que voc√™ for jogar. Ap√≥s terminar o mapeamento, basta selecionar o perfil desejado e deixar o Zeemote rodando em segundo plano: Voc√™ j√° est√° livre para jogar o jogo que desejar. Ao iniciar o jogo, j√° me surpreendi: A resposta do Zeemote √© inacredit√°velmente rapida, sem nenhum delay, √© realmente √≥tima.

Passei uns 20 minutos jogando e admito que de inicio foi dif√≠cil me acostumar com o Zeemote, mas aos poucos fui pegando o jeito e mudando o mapeamento das teclas, at√© chegar as configura√ß√µes perfeitas. Apesar da resposta r√°pida, o bluetooth n√£o √© uma rede de transmiss√£o de dados veloz, ent√£o o que j√° me aconteceu foi que a resposta do Zeemote travava e por um segundo n√£o respondia os meus comandos, como eu j√° estava com o celular na m√£o, automaticamente continuava jogando com as teclas do pr√≥prio celular e logo em seguida a resposta do Zeemote j√° estava boa novamente.

Infelizmente isso aconteceu algumas vezes e realmente atrapalha a jogabilidade, principalmente em uma parte crucial onde muitos comandos s√£o enviados ao mesmo tempo, mas eu acredito que esse problema pode ser resolvido nas pr√≥ximas vers√µes Zeekey. Outro problema que eu encontrei foi por causa dos pr√≥prios jogos: As empresas n√£o criam jogos pensando no Zeemote (obviamente), ent√£o alguns comandos, como movimentar o personagem na diagonal, n√£o s√£o reconhecidos perfeitamente pelo jogo, o que deixa a movimenta√ß√£o meio confusa. N√£o sei se poder√° ser implementada uma melhora no Zeekey sobre esse problema, infelizmente.

As duas pilhas AAA duram bastante no Zeemote, nesse um m√™s de uso eu n√£o tive que trocar nenhuma vez, e eu joguei viciadamente, carregava o Zeemote para todos os lugares. Alias, isso foi tamb√©m um ponto que eu pensava que poderia ser negativo: Carregar o Zeemote pra l√° e pra c√°. Quem quer andar com um joystick no bolso? Voc√™ logo pensa que isso √© um problema ou que ser√° incomodo carrega-lo para todos os lugares.

Eu passei os primeiros dias carregando ele no bolso, e acabei me acostumando e posso dizer que n√£o me incomodou em nada, na verdade o Zeemote agora faz parte do meu chaveiro. Ele √© leve e bem pequeno, praticamente do tamanho daqueles primeiros MP3 players da Sony. A minha experi√™ncia com o Zeemote no √∫ltimo m√™s foi muito boa e acredito que s√≥ tende a melhorar. Resumindo: Se voc√™ se considera viciado em videogames, compre um Zeemote. Tem coisa melhor que jogar Super Mario World na aula de √âtica e Cidadania? üòÖ

Como todo review que se preze, tenho que dar uma nota, ent√£o ai vai: 8.0

Nota final: 8.0

Os v√≠deos abaixo mostram eu jogando alguns jogos com o Zeemote, d√° pra ver que a resposta dele √© excelente mesmo.

Resident Evil: Degeneration:

node.excerpt: These days I was at the market, choosing what to eat with‚Ä¶
node.html:
These days I was at the market, choosing what to eat with little money, and I found a Hot Pocket from Sadia for R$3.00, I didn‚Äôt think it was expensive so I decided to buy it to see if it‚Äôs really good, I got home and put it in the microwave for 1:30 minutes and when I took the first bite and ü§© wow, very good! For those who like burger from Mc Donalds, Bobs among others, you‚Äôll like it because it‚Äôs the same style of burger, okay it‚Äôs not so tasty but it‚Äôs very good = D. The bread is soft and the meat of the burger too, you just can‚Äôt leave too much time in the microwave or you can pass the point and make the bread a little hard, but in the box comes the right instructions for you not to leave your Hot Pocket pass the point.

The only problem is the price, it is not R$3.00 reais as the first time I bought it, the normal price I find there is R$4.70 and with luck R$3.50.

Today I went to the market and went to check the price: R$2.60!!! It was very cheap, so I bought ten of them lol! I have a stock of Hot Pockets here at home, until at least the next two weeks.

If you like burgers, I advise you to keep an eye on the offers and take advantage when Hot Pocket is in a good price range.

Hot Pocket from Sadia really impressed me and now it‚Äôs on the list of my quick meals at home, if I were to give a general score, it would be 7.0. A comparative note: For a Mc Donalds burger I‚Äôd give it an 8.0.

Final score: 7.0

Photos of my ten Hot Pocket:

Hot Pocket commercial:

node.excerpt: Did you know that in every product you buy, you‚Äôre paying‚Ä¶
node.html:
Did you know that in every product you buy, you‚Äôre paying more for taxes / services the by the product itself? Every month you pay a fee from your salary, to pay taxes, and every month you pay car taxes, house. Nowadays you pay taxes even to go to your friend‚Äôs house, and don‚Äôt even know that, and still, Brazil is able to create new ways to steal our money. With the common internet shopping, many people decide to risk themselves and buy exterior products, with the risk of being taxed. This is how it works: If you buy a product, regardless of what it costs, of a company, you‚Äôll be taxed, that‚Äôs the law of this country. So, the few people that thought that they would buy some things, for reasonable prices, were wrong.

Many products go without being taxed, because it‚Äôs a large amount of mail that get everyday on Brazil.

But, there is a small truce to the ones who have friends outside Brazil, if a person sends a product to another person and less than 50.00 dollars, it cannot be taxed. That‚Äôs good, right? We can still be happy, if you have friends outside.

Recently was the release day of Pok√©mon Platinum, for DS . I‚Äôm addicted to Pok√©mon, and I ran after its pre release and my Giratine‚Äôs Action Figure :D! The pre-order was made on Amazon.com, but unfortunately they don‚Äôt send Nintendo products to Brazil, I don‚Äôt know why, so I asked a friends of mine who lives in Los Angeles to buy and send it to me, so I‚Äôve got it by Priority Mail International and the declared value of it was 35,00 dollars. I was already happy, close to get the cartridge before everyone in Brazil, so I‚Äôve realized that the product has gone to verify it there were any taxes or not!

That‚Äôs when I got furious, and with reason, because it‚Äôs almost making one month that my friend sent it, and it was by Priority Mail International, delivering in 7 days, I paid expensive to be quick, and it‚Äôs stuck in there! The product comes with the fiscal note, and with my own, and my friends name on the envelope. That‚Äôs ok, I won‚Äôt be taxed, but still, the product took more than 4 times to get here, even going legally.

End of the history: Not only we pay taxes even for breathing, when we have the pleasure to get a present from a friend, they do that just to screw us, for fun!

Brazil \o/
node.rawMarkdownBody:
![taxes](../../uploads/blog/2009/04/taxas.png "taxes")

Did you know that in every product you buy, you're paying more for taxes / services the by the product itself? Every month you pay a fee from your salary, to pay taxes, and every month you pay car taxes, house. Nowadays you pay taxes even to go to your friend's house, and don't even know that, and still, Brazil is able to create new ways to steal our money. With the common internet shopping, many people decide to risk themselves and buy exterior products, with the risk of being taxed. This is how it works: If you buy a product, regardless of what it costs, of a company, you'll be taxed, that's the law of this country. So, the few people that thought that they would buy some things, for reasonable prices, were wrong.

Many products go without being taxed, because it's a large amount of mail that get everyday on Brazil.

But, there is a small truce to the ones who have friends outside Brazil, if a person sends a product to another person and less than 50.00 dollars, it cannot be taxed. That's good, right? We can still be happy, if you have friends outside.

Recently was the release day of [Pok√©mon Platinum](http://pokemonplatinum.com/ "official website"), for [DS](http://nintendods.com/ "official website") . I'm addicted to Pok√©mon, and I ran after its pre release and my [Giratine's Action Figure](http://kidconfidence.com/blogs/2009/02/11/pokemon-platinum-giratina-figure/ "Giratina Action Figure") :D! The pre-order was made on [Amazon.com](http://amazon.com/ "Site oficial"), but unfortunately they don't send [Nintendo](http://nintendo.com/ "Site oficial") products to Brazil, I don't know why, so I asked a friends of mine who lives in Los Angeles to buy and send it to me, so I've got it by [Priority Mail International](http://www.usps.com/international/prioritymailinternational.htm "USPS.com") and the declared value of it was 35,00 dollars. I was already happy, close to get the cartridge before everyone in Brazil, so I've realized that the product has gone to verify it there were any taxes or not!

That's when I got furious, and with reason, because it's almost making one month that my friend sent it, and it was by [Priority Mail International](http://www.usps.com/international/prioritymailinternational.htm "USPS.com"), delivering in 7 days, I paid expensive to be quick, and it's stuck in there! The product comes with the fiscal note, and with my own, and my friends name on the envelope. That's ok, I won't be taxed, but still, the product took more than 4 times to get here, even going legally.

End of the history: Not only we pay taxes even for breathing, when we have the pleasure to get a present from a friend, they do that just to screw us, for fun!

Brazil \o/

frontmatter.title: Brazilian taxes

Eu j√° estava feliz, prestes a receber a fitinha junto com todo mundo que estava esperando o lan√ßamento no Brasil, e ent√£o eu percebi que o produto tinha ido para verifica√ß√£o para ver se ia ser taxado ou n√£o!

Foi a√≠ que eu fiquei revoltado, e com todo o motivo, j√° vai fazer um m√™s que o meu amigo me enviou, sendo que foi por Priority Mail International, entrega em 7 dias, eu paguei caro para ele me enviar por esse m√©todo, para ficar preso na alfandega! O produto acompanha nota fiscal com declara√ß√£o do valor, o valor declarado no envelope e o nome do meu amigo como remetente e o meu como destinat√°rio. Moral da hist√≥ria: Al√©m da gente pagar impostos at√© para respirar, quando temos um alivio de receber um presente de um amigo, eles fazem quest√£o de nos sacanear, s√≥ por divers√£o!

Brasil \o/
